Event.name: Entourage
Event.definition:
<def-root>A group of <fen>Individuals</fen> form a group, the <fen>Entourage</fen>, which remains co-located with the Attended_person. The <fen>Entourage</fen> may have a specific Purpose for following the Attended_person, such as to protect or serve him or her, or the Purpose may be vague (e.g., to be near a person of power).
<ex>Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by <fex name="att">his</fex> <t><fex name="ent">entourage</fex></t> <fex name="Ind">of junior doctors and medical students</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The CEO arrived with a <fex name="ent_p">comparatively small</fex> <t><fex name="ent">escort</fex></t> <fex name="Ind">of 30 individuals</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Individuals
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the people or things that form the <fen>Entourage</fen>.
<ex>Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by his <t>entourage</t> <fex name="Ind">of junior doctors and medical students</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entourage
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the collection of entities that follow the Attended.
<ex>Most of the large <fex name="ent"><t>entourage</t></fex> the president had brought with him quietly left him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Aggregate_property
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes a property of the <fen>Entourage</fen> rather than the <fen>Individuals</fen> and is used to tag the adjective that modifies the entourage noun when it is unambiguous.
<ex>Most of the <fex name="Aggregate_property">large</fex> <t>entourage</t> the president had brought with him quietly left him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Name
Arg.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to the <fen>Entourage</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Container_possessor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location or political locale that the <fen>Entourage</fen> exists within.</def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition: <def-root>The relevant <fen>Domain</fen> as it pertains to the <fen>Entourage</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Attended_person
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Attended_person</fen> is followed by the <fen>Entourage</fen>.
<ex><fex name="att">The lord's</fex> <t>train</t> consisted of several dozen servants, cooks, and other attendants.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: entourage.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group of people attending to an important or famous individual.

lexUnit.name: retinue.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group accompanying and sometimes advising an important person.
